text: Thank you Chefs (old friends) for such great food and good time! We are amazed about chef's specials, flavourable thai food, friendly and attentive service and on top of that it's a BYOB. Laughs, eat and drink... Memorable evening! Nice place to be with friends and family.  Thank you very much - arkoun? chraen!  Sokho old friend

Attentive service.  Food seems good, but they had a timing issue for meals.  2 of the 4 meals ordered were cold because the others weren't ready. Also, their "vegetarian" menu is not truly vegetarian.  Too bad, because I really enjoy a good peanut butter sauce.  A typical misunderstanding of "vegetarian" wherein fish and seafood products are ok (it's not vegetarian if an animal died to make it).  If that concerns you (fish sauce, oyster sauce, etc) you have to ask to make sure. Besides their Thai dishes, they have sushi too.  I recommend the dessert sushi for sure!

Their sushi is a tad expensive however, it is not overpriced. The sushi is fresh, tasty and just so good! Their a la carte menu is reasonably priced & also delicious. However that being said, if you're not a big fan of "extra saucy" cuisine, ask for any sauce on the side or very little of it. They tend to over sauce the dishes (aka: peanut butter sauce with chicken, not chicken with peanut butter sauce).

This really made a splash when it opened a couple of years ago. A Thai restaurant in an immigrate neighbourhood who mostly eats at home.  When they started, the food was superb. The curry was delicate and fragrant.  Then the sushi bar appeared.  It was obvious they weren't breaking even and the food, the service and the experience have suffered.  I still recommend their chicken salad ( serve with mint, cucumbers and nuts) but always take it to go.

We had reserved for a group of 18 people. When you are over a certain number of guests in a group, the "policy" is that you have to order a minimum of $25 or they charge you $25 if your order does not amount to it. One of our guests was not agreeing with this as he just wanted one main dish which was $14. When he voiced his disagreement, the manager was called over and he was very rude and confrontational. He said that if our guest does not order for $25 he will ask him to leave. I have never seen this policy in my life before and I think it's utterly ridiculous. Just sounds like the restaurant is not making enough money.

Love this place!   Been going there regularly for over 7 years. I love the Pad Thai, but also Highly recommend the Duck Curry.  The service is very good and they serve some of the best Sushi in town. Must try the fried icecream!  Highly recommended for all, families & couples or outing among friends. It has become a bring your own wine in the past couple of years, so very affordable for all.

I've been going to Phuket for several years. The food is on par if not better than other Thai restaurants I've been to in the city. The curry dishes are very flavourable.  The menu has also been expanding adding in other Asian dishes. Throw in excellent friendly service and you have a nice eating experience in the East End.

Nous avons tous été extrêmement malades après avoir visité ce restaurant. Pour l'un d'entre nous cette "indigestion" (ou peu importe ce que ça a été) a duré pendant une semaine!  Faites-vous une faveur en évitant à tout prix ce resto horrible. Il y a sûrement un manque d'hygiène, car ils ont fort probablement contaminé notre nourriture ou eau, et c'est simplement répugnant. Vous venez de nous perdre comme clients assurément! 0/10

Samedi soir, le resto est complet.Les gens de l'Est m'avais parlé beaucoup de ce resto, qu'il était super bon et tout mais j'ai été déçu. Peut-être n'ai-je pas commandé la spécialité? Bref, j'ai pris un Chow Mein aux fruit de mers (style Cantonais, avec des nouilles croustillantes). Certes, c'était bien mais je pouvais remarquer que les fruits de mer n'étaient pas frais, il y avait un arrière goût de congeler. 24$ avec taxes et tips. Pas mal plus cher qu'au Chinatown et moins bon. Bien-sûr nous sommes dans un resto plus chic que ceux du chinatown et c'est un apportez votre vin. J'ai goûter les plats de mes amis autour de moi. Le général thai délicieux! Si j'y retourne je vais choisir ce plat. J'ai goûté à une entrée avec de la viande cru c'était bon. Un calmar aussi délicieux. Mais le tartare, cela m'a étonné qu'un resto dit Bar à Sushi offre un tartare aussi fade. De plus, il était un peu chaud, pas chaud dans le sens cuit mais dans le sens plus chaud que température ambiante. Le restaurant ferme à 11h pile et le staff nous le fera comprendre assez vite. Par contre, le serveur et le staff super gentil et amical. Super endroit pour faire un souper d'anniversaire.
They're always consistent with sushi quality and don't ever disappoint. This is my go-to sushi place. Their ginger Thai quail is fantastic.

One of the fancier Thai restaurants in St-Leo/Rosemont. The interior was much nicer than what you would expect if you judged based on the exterior. Good choices of meat and seafood dishes, as well as a sushi bar. I had the salt and pepper calamari as an entree and the seafood green curry as my main. Both were tasty, well presented and reasonably priced. The portions were also very reasonable. My friend had the salmon tartare and red chicken curry, which she enjoyed. This resto is a nice option for a date or special occasion. I wouldn't come here weekly because it is a little on the pricier side (not a casual resto). Next time I'll be trying the sushi!
Great place.  Nice plates and sushi. Take out is also good. Clean and nice staff. Summer has a terrace
I love this place. I wish I would go more often. The staff is super friendly and helpful. The food is delish. And it's Byob...... There are NO bad things to say. I can't wait to go back.

My go to place when I'm craving Thai. Has many choices and it's a Byob. Great flavors, sushi and very well priced.   When I go the waiter knows my husband so I ask him to make me the "chefs special". It's not on the menu but if you ask for it they will make it. Two pieces of salmon on a bed of crispy spinach stuffed with crab meat and topped with green opinion and caviar. Anyone if their soups are great. I've tried a lot on the menu and everything is good!

Le resto est plein-plein-plein les samedis soirs, alors les tablées se succèdent. Pour pouvoir vous attarder à votre place sans vous sentir pressés, prenez une réservation à 19h et vous serez assurés qu'il n'y aura pas de réservation qui vous suivra et donc que vous pourrez garder votre table aussi longtemps qu'il vous plaira.  Autant le serveur que l'hôtesse nous ont prévenus qu'ils étaient à pleine capacité, comme s'ils voulaient s'excuser d'avance de possibles lacunes à leur service pendant notre passage dans leur établissement. Au final, ça s'est très bien passé et malgré quelques erreurs dans les commandes, j'ai trouvé notre serveur efficace, disponible et même gentil/drôle. Ça m'a juste laissé inutiliement le sentiment que je serais peut-être déçue dès le départ. De toute manière, ce n'est pas vraiment à nous de baisser nos attentes si vous acceptez trop de gens/que vous n'avez pas les employés requis pour rouler ça en douceur, non?  Les plats sont copieux, il a été difficile de terminer entrée partagée + plat principal + dessert. J'opterais pour une autre stratégie, partager l'entrée et partager le plat principal aussi. Ça ferait descendre la facture aussi un peu, qui n'est pas démesurée, mais qui reflète quand même l'ambiance plus jolie que dans les restaurants familiaux du quartier chinois. Ça m'a rappelé la chaîne P.F. Changs en terme de décor et de présentation des assiettes plus soignées, mais de nourriture plus américanisée...   J'ai gouté (mes commandes et celles de mes parents, héhé):  ++  Calmars frits au poivre et sel. L'espèce de salsa qui les accompagnait était le "match" parfait.  Tataki de thon. Canard au cari rouge. La portion de viande est plus que satisfaisante, le riz en à-côté aurait pu être un peu plus "collant" pour me combler.  +  Légumes et poulet tempura. Gâteau opéra au thé matcha. Son goût est super, mais il nous a été servi un p'tit peu trop froid, la gaufrette au fond était encore un peu congelée, je pense, elle était difficile à briser avec nos fourchettes.

I've had Sushi at Japanese places (no brainer here). Sushi at Korean Places (most places in Toronto are...), and even Sushi at Chinese places. However, not at a Thai place.  Was late and I just wanted some good food and a drink to wash away the hard work of the day. After circling around St. Leonard, we saw this place. I wasn't in the mood for Thai but what the heck. It was getting late and most places were starting to close. After sitting, my buddy says...let's have sushi! I was confused...why come to a Thai place to have raw fish. It's like asking for hamburgers at a vegan hut! Maybe not that drastic. I said...OK. Remarkably, the sushi was pretty good. We got the Chef's selection for two. What added to my confusion is that I wanted Sake or an Asahi or a Sapporo or any kind of refreshing drink! Well...no go. It looks like they didn't have a liquor license and BYOB was the only solution. My head hurts.
